title: Zuckerberg changes tune on free speech, Facebook brand value declines
text: MarketWatch Tech Editor Jeremy Owens and Chatham Road Partners Director of Research Colin Gillis discuss how Mark Zuckerberg's perspectives on free speech have changed recently.

title: Standards for Facebook should be same as magazine or TV: Rep. Ro Khanna
text: Congressman Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) discusses Facebook and the growing scrutiny of Big Tech companies.

title: Zuckerberg: We need to save internet from Chinese influence
text: Mark Zuckerberg thinks Facebook is the internet.

title: 5 Top Stock Trades for Friday: MS, FB, HON, GOGO, UNP
text: Union Pacific, Facebook, Gogo, Morgan Stanley and Honeywell were our top stock trades from Thursday. Here's a look at the charts.

title: Zuckerberg defends Facebook as bastion of 'free expression' in speech
text: CEO faces quick backlash over highlighted policies, including on hate speech and voter suppression

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg defends decision to allow politicians to lie in ads
text: The social network has faced criticism for not sending political speech to fact checkers.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg defends free expression, will allow political adds without fact checking
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg asserted his commitment to free speech over more aggressive policing of social-media platforms, in a rare policy speech that could have ramifications for the U.S.

title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg on the Power of Expression
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said that the social network, with its enormous size and scale, offers people a new kind of power: the ability to share their thoughts with the masses. Zuckerberg spoke to students at Georgetown University’s Gaston Hall in Washington.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg speaks on free expression at Georgetown
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui on the headlines from Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's speech at Georgetown University where he address the topic of free speech.

title: Zuckerberg: I thought about banning political ads from Facebook, but decided not to
text: "Political ads can be an important part of voice, especially for local candidates, up and coming challengers and advocacy groups that the media might not otherwise cover," Zuckerberg said.

title: Zuckerberg on Chinese censorship: Is that the internet we want?
text: China is exporting its social values, political ads are an important part of free expression, and the definition of dangerous speech must be kept in check, Facebook’s CEO Mark Zuckerberg argued today. He criticized how American companies that do business with China were becoming influenced by the country’s values.

title: Zuckerberg, Inflaming Debate, Asserts Facebook Stands for Free Expression
text: In an address at Georgetown University, the Facebook chief executive called for more free speech — not less — as his company has been assailed for allowing lies and falsehoods to appear.

title: Mark Zuckerberg giving speech on freedom of expression
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is set to deliver what he says is his most "comprehensive take" yet on freedom of expression Thursday in Washington, amid a roiling controversy over how the company handles political speech.

title: The comments on Mark Zuckerberg’s free-speech address sure look censored
text:
Almost every single one includes the words “thank you.” 
As Mark Zuckerberg gave a speech on free speech today, there was something funky happening in the comments on his Facebook Live broadcast.

title: A new bill threatens years of jail time for companies that misuse consumer data
text: A privacy-focused US senator is introducing sweeping legislation on Thursday that imposes sharp penalties on companies and executives who fail to protect consumer data, bringing additional pressure to bear on the tech industry.

title: Facebook loses spot in top-ten on list of most valuable brands
text: This top list of valuable brands includes Apple, Google and Amazon, but not Facebook.

title: Kohl's will partner with Facebook in 2020
text: Kohl's Corp. KSS, -0.84% said Thursday that it will partner with Facebook Inc. FB, +0.35% in 2020 to select and engage with brands that will be included in its recently launched platform, Curated by Kohl's, and its platform for emerging beauty and skincare brands, The Beauty Checkout.

title: Even If Libra Is a Disaster, Facebook Stock Will Keep on Growing
text: As I noted about three months ago when I last visited Facebook stock in this space, the company, by its own doing, is viewed by some as arrogant if not somewhat reckless, prone to public relations gaffes and lacks for trust among the public. The latter issue is one of the sticking points when it comes to Libra.

title: Investment strategist doubts Facebook's Libra will be a real payments disruptor
text: Richard Harris, chief executive of Port Shelter Investment Management, says there are plenty of innovations in the payments sector already.

title: Facebook Is Losing Employees to One of Its Most Viable Emerging Competitors
text: The social networking giant can't buy its rival this time.

title: How to watch Mark Zuckerberg's speech about 'voice and free expression' Thursday
text: The Facebook boss will livestream his comments about "the challenges that more voice and the internet introduce," as well as global threats to free expression.

title: Facebook is 'addictive, bad for us,' says Salesforce CEO
text: Marc Benioff says the social media platform needs to be "held accountable for propaganda."

title: Zuckerberg meets with lawmakers ahead of next week's testimony
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports that Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg was at the Capitol today.

title: Facebook's Libra Co-Founder still hoping for 2020 launch despite regulatory challenges
text: The Facebook-led Libra Association lost numerous investors last week including Visa and MasterCard. However, this week it locked in 21 founding members at a meeting in Geneva. Yahoo Finance’s Brian Cheung sat down with Facebook’s Calibra Head David Marcus to discuss about Libra's trials and tribulations.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff says Facebook is a corrosive influence and should be broken up
text: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff hasn't been sparing with his criticism of Facebook. But in an interview with CNN's Poppy Harlow Wednesday he went one significant step further and added his name to the list of those who support breaking up the social media giant.

title: Tech companies under fire for security liabilities
text: Nancy Scola, senior technology reporter at Politico, and CNBC's Ylan Mui join "The Exchange" to talk about tech companies taking on liability issues.

title: Uptake of libra currency could increase exchange rate risk: Obama adviser | IMF Annual Meetings 2019
text: Jason Furman, professor of the practice of economic policy at Harvard Kennedy School, discusses digital currencies.

title: Facebook executive confident Libra will win enough financial backers
text: Facebook Inc , whose digital currency project Libra has been abandoned by several high-profile partners including PayPal, Visa and Mastercard, still expects to get 100 banks and financial firms on board once it addresses regulatory concerns, the head of the project said on Wednesday.

title: Facebook won't have access to libra data, head of Calibra says
text: Calibra chief David Marcus discusses privacy concerns around Facebook's digital currency project.

title: No shortage of global desire to help launch libra currency: Calibra chief
text: David Marcus, head of Calibra, the digital wallet for Facebook's proposed cryptocurrency libra, discusses the future of payments.

title: Libra would have a 'very wide range of issues' to resolve: Carney
text: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney discusses big tech's presence in the financial services market and the future of payments.

title: Better Tech Stock Buy: Facebook vs. Google Parent Alphabet
text: Which of these big tech stocks is the better investment for the long term?

title: Libra co-creator Marcus: 'There is no shortage of desire and shared mission to join this effort'
text: The co-creator of Facebook-backed cryptocurrency libra said there is still strong demand from organizations to join the project.

title: Can Facebook's Libra be a Winner in Emerging Markets?
text: Libra could be the ideal digital currency to benefit emerging markets owing to its technical expertise and secure blockchain technology.

title: Libra's co-creator at Facebook touts progress after an exodus of key backers of the crypto coin
text: David Marcus, head of Facbook's Calibra digital wallet, says, "It wasn't a tough week," despite the news of Libra backers recently abandoning the project.
